New Records: Cleveland tied a franchise record with 83 points in the first half.
Cleveland set a team record with a 41-point halftime lead.
Cleveland surpassed 130 points five times this season, matching the franchise record, done in just 10 games.
Key Match Events: Cleveland's offense used motion and screens to create easy baskets.
Donovan Mitchell's poor shooting (4 of 13 points) didn't hinder the team's effectiveness.
Pre-Game Insights: Steve Kerr compared Cleveland's style to the Warriors' early teams, highlighting fast-paced play and three-point shooting.
Kenny Atkinson's coaching emphasized motion offense and leverage of players like Evan Mobley and Jarrett Allen.
Post-Match Reflections: Steve Kerr praised Cleveland's performance and their evolution under Atkinson.
Draymond Green noted Cleveland's aggressive offense and defensive strength.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cleveland's young, athletic roster and defensive intensity were key factors.
Cleveland's impressive 10-0 start with the league's best record was noted.
Others: Comparison of Kerr's impact on Warriors and Atkinson's on Cavaliers was highlighted.
